intro: Barleria strigosa var. semiorbicularis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are usually arranged in dense clusters and bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders.
